choices.name: inspectitem
choices.description: shows you details about an item

choices.name: winning
choices.description: Tells you how to win the game.

arguments:
To win, you must defeat an enemy labeled 'FINALBOSS'.

                                    Winning does not give any special perks yet.

choices.name: interacting
choices.description: Tells you how to interact with the game.

arguments:
Chose one of the choices given and pass it the correct arguments.

                                    The arguments are shown in 'usage' label.

                                    If you do not use the choice correctly, you are told so, and nothing happens.

choices.name: death
choices.description: Tells you what happens when you die.

arguments:
When you die, you lose half your coins, magic points, and metal scraps

                                    and you are put back to the menu location.

To save your current game state, navigate to the in game menu,

                                    and chose the 'savegame' choice. The save file is located in

                                    the 'saves' directory at the root of the repository.
Choice outputs tell you what the choice did and if there is something wrong.

choices.name: lastcommand
choices.description: Tells you about the last command.

arguments:
The last command is given to you at the beginning of the turn.

                                    It tells you what you last inputted exactly.

choices.name: displaycolors
choices.description: Tells you how to use display colors.

arguments:
For a better explanation and how to use them, visit

                                    https://github.com/pigcoder3/Text-Fighter/wiki/Configuration.

                                    The display colors file changes the display colors of the output.

choices.name: mods
choices.description: Tells you how to use mods.

arguments:
Mods should be placed in the 'packs' directory in the root of the repository.

                                    The name of the mod you would like to use should be specified in the 'pack' file

                                    on its own line in the config directory which is located in the root of the directory.
